file_content.text: It's an honor to serve a Jedi--especially one on a mission like yours. Victory or death.
I'll requisition my gear and meet you at your ship.
Grab a bunk and make yourself at home.
See you there.
I still have business here. You should come with me.
Wait. [Change companion]
Fine by me. I'm ready to thaw out.
Aw, gee. I was hoping to see more snow and ice. Maybe next time.
T7 = using ship de-icers to thaw servomotors
I'll just have my gear delivered to your ship, then. Lead on, Master Jedi.
Get going, Sergeant. I'll be leaving soon.
You're dismissed.
As ordered, Master Jedi.
Good to see you. I was just finishing my mission report.
I'll have my new squad in position ASAP. We won't let you down.
We'll keep our target busy as long as we have to. Good luck, Master Jedi.
Hope this isn't a bad time, Master Jedi.
We took out the other reactor--but General Grayne just alerted me to a secondary objective.
The White Maw has a series of munitions dumps here. Scouts report those weapons are headed for the dreadnaught.
General Grayne believes the pirates are reinforcing. He ordered me to hit those munitions dumps. Thought you might want to join in.
I don't want the enemy well-armed when we assault that dreadnaught.
Wouldn't miss it.
You're not under General Grayne's authority until my mission is complete. Understood?
You only take orders from me.
General Grayne is supreme commander here. Ignoring a direct order from him would be highly irregular.
Cutting off the weapon supplies before they reach that dreadnaught makes your mission easier.
I estimate my squad can destroy the munitions dumps with minimal casualties. Two or three men, tops.
I'm sure the casualties will be fewer if I help.
I'll join you.
Transmitting coordinates to you now. If you can hit at least half, my men will handle the rest.
We'll rendezvous with you at the outpost when this mission's complete. Sergeant Rusk out....
I want your squad intact for the assault on that dreadnaught. Leave those munitions dumps alone.
Do not obey General Grayne.
General Grayne doesn't understand the bigger picture. I'll explain everything to him later. Clear?
Yes, Master Jedi. We'll meet you at the outpost shortly. Rusk out....
Just make sure you have enough men left to assault that dreadnaught.
Go, then. [Refuse quest]
You handle the pirates. I need to rendezvous with my fellow Jedi.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
Understood. I'll double-time the men through this and meet you ASAP. Rusk out....
We'll have our target down in no time. Count on it.
The White Maw maintains a depot inside a crashed dreadnaught. Everything they loot goes there.
At least our objective is clear.
That's our next stop.
Sounds like you've dealt with these pirates before. Tell me about them.
What else do you know?
Before the Empire arrived, I was fighting the White Maw. They're well-armed, heavily fortified, clever scum.
White Maw has its own dreadnaught?
Is the vessel theirs?
It was a Republic flagship during the war. The White Maw moved in but doesn't control all of it.
The pirates secure their depot with ray shields. We'll have to find some way past them to reach those databanks.
The Meedees scouted White Maw territory. They located two reactors buried beneath the ice.
They're no doubt powering the ray shields. If we destroy the reactors, we can enter the pirate depot.
Sergeant Rusk, head for these coordinates and destroy the reactor there. My friend will destroy the one at these coordinates.
If your squad runs into trouble, contact me.
Take care, Sergeant.
Likewise, Master Jedi.
Won't we have better odds if we combine our forces?
Splitting up seems unwise.
We need to strike the reactors simultaneously. Otherwise, we risk giving the pirates a chance to fortify the second one.
My men are up to the task, Master Jedi. We won't let you down.
Are you planning to sit this one out?
You're not coming?
We can't leave the Imperial here, and he's a liability on a combat mission. You're twice the warrior I am.
I'll escort our prisoner to the Republic outpost near the starship graveyard. The Meedees will perform reconnaissance on the dreadnaught.
When both pirate reactors are destroyed, meet me at the outpost and we'll plan our assault. May the Force be with us.
Got here soon as we could. Had to engage some Imperial patrols in our way, but nothing serious.
Nothing serious? Privates Vanth and Edder don't know what day it is. We're lucky to all be alive!
Shut it down, Private! I don't tolerate insubordination.
All of you, please listen. I know you've been through a lot. I understand your frustration.
Everyone calm down.
But a good Jedi--a good soldier--puts emotions aside to do what's necessary.
To say the fate of the galaxy depends on us is no exaggeration. We must hold together.
You should run for the Senate.
Keep that up, the Republic might make you a general.
T7 = served many battlefield commanders // Jedi = the best
Let's honor this Jedi by giving our all.
Listen up. You signed your lives away when you joined the Republic Army. Complaining won't change that.
I'll restore discipline.
The Empire wants us dead. You can run, or kill them first.
If you're frustrated, take it out on the enemy--not your commander.
Appealing to hatred. That's one way to inspire the troops....
Guess that was better than mind-tricking them....
Jedi = persuasive // Destroy Empire = best plan
I don't want any of you throwing your lives away--unless you take ten times as many Imperials with you.
You men will follow Sergeant Rusk's orders to the letter. You will not complain.
[Force Persuade] Obey him.
We'll follow Sergeant Rusk's orders to the letter. We won't complain.
Was that your version of a pep talk?
Mind-tricking our own people. Not sure I'm on board with that.
Jedi = removing free will? // T7 = worried
Thank you, Master Jedi. I appreciate the vote of confidence.
Here... found this on an Imperial major. Might be useful.
This is the scientist's vessel. And look what I found hiding under a dead Imperial officer....
The rest of your unit is dead, Imperial. Start talking, or you'll join them.
Please, I don't know anything. I'm just a computer tech.
The Empire sent you here for a reason. Let's start with that.
You know something.
We won't hurt you--but the more you help us, the more we can help you.
I promise you won't be harmed.
When I said I didn't know anything, that wasn't completely true....
You're a soon-to-be-dead computer tech, unless you become useful.
Then we don't need you alive.
What my friend means is, we'd appreciate your full cooperation.
My job was to slice the databanks of this old starship, but the White Maw beat us to them. They lifted the whole network.
The pirates stole the ship's databanks?
They took everything valuable--but they missed the computer decryption file. They can't read the databanks without this.
I'll be taking that.
I'll re-constitute my squad and join you shortly. You should take those maps to Leeha Narezz.
That all of them, Private?
Yes, sir. Did they cut the lights, or....
Squad fatalities: eighty-three point three percent.
I shouldn't have put him in this fight.
That poor man.
He died saving the galaxy. We should all be so lucky.
We'd better move out before more reinforcements arrive.
Let's get out of here.
I'll take the private's identichip. Don't want him reported MIA.
At least he was useful before he died.
He served his purpose.
That's a soldier's duty.
Enemy fatalities: one hundred percent. You can come out now, Private.
Yes, sir. Thank you, sir.
Thank this Jedi for doing your job, soldier.
Sergeant, evacuate your man to a medical facility.
Get the private to safety.
I'm just glad you're safe, Private.
Thanks aren't necessary.
Any soldier trashing the Jedi gets a punch in the mouth from me. That's a promise.
If I hadn't been here, you'd be dead.
You owe me your life, Private.
I'm not cut out for this. Maybe I can transfer to the waste disposal corps.
These are the Imperial survey maps of the starship graveyard. Leeha Narezz wants to see them.
I'll return to base and re-constitute my squad. We'll meet you at her coordinates ASAP. Stay sharp out there.
Leeha Narezz sent me. Looks like I got here just in time.
No worries, Master Jedi. I was prepared to hold this position indefinitely.
Sergeant Fideltin Rusk, 301st Infantry. My squad's at your service.
There's no more squad. We're all that's left!
We're a squad until I say otherwise, Private. Now on your feet.
Your man's in need of a kolto tank.
He can barely stand.
For starters. He's got third-degree burns and shrapnel wounds.
You're a squad of one, Sergeant.
Bio-sensors = indicate high trauma // Surgery droid = required
He can hold a rifle. That's all the mission requires.
Leeha said you're working with us. How did you get trapped here?
Tell me your mission.
No time for R & R. Imperial forces are everywhere.
You heard the sergeant.
Take it easy. That soldier needs medical attention.
R & R? He needs a kolto tank.
Solider = wounded // Bio-sensors = detecting high trauma
Reload your weapons, Private. The mission isn't complete.
Our objective was to secure Imperial survey maps of the starship graveyard. Target achieved.
Imperial counter-attackers pursued us here. Squad fatalities: sixty-six point four percent. Enemy fatalities: one hundred percent.
Hang on... I'm picking up a fresh wave of probe droids outside. They're headed this way!
The sergeant and I will handle this. Keep your head down.
Find some cover, Private.
No loafing. You see a shot, take it.
Yes, sir. Here they come!
Keep him alive. I'll handle the droids myself.
Protect your man, Sergeant.
Get behind me, Private.
Thank you, sir. Here they come!
Make those droids sorry they ever came here.
Everyone prepare for battle!
You heard her. Secure that door.
You heard him. Secure that door.
Here they come!
Sergeant Rusk, 301st Infantry.
I just destroyed one of the White Maw's reactors. What's your status, Sergeant?
Nothing serious? You should've sent Privates Vanth and Edder back to base. Those blasted turrets killed them both!
